entry.title: Issue with Batch-Specific UOM Quantity Display in Warehouse Monitor vs MMBE in SAP Public Cloud.
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

While receiving material with batch-specific UOM through synchronous goods receipt in Warehouse Management in SAP Public Cloud, I observed an issue.

The base UOM for the material is TO, and the alternative UOM is EA. I am receiving the material in EA with a batch-specific UOM ratio, where each EA is considered as a handling unit. However, when I check the received quantity in the Warehouse Monitor app, the EA is displayed according to the batch-specific UOM ratio instead of reflecting the actual received quantity in EA.

On the other hand, when I check in MMBE, the receiving quantity is displayed correctly.

Could you please advise on the reason for this discrepancy and the possible resolution?

entry.title: Re: SAP table PTRV_VENDOR_SYNC different S4Coreop 106 and...
entry.content:
From your post, I presume that either the refactored logic is not yet exposed via DDIC structures in SP 0003, or SAP has moved the configuration to a different layer, possibly embedded in CVI (Customer-Vendor Integration) or BP role synchronization logic.

Please try with the below workarounds

Go to SPRO ‚Üí Cross-Application Components ‚Üí Master Data Synchronization ‚Üí Synchronize Employee to Business Partner. This area now governs much of the HR-to-BP sync logic, including vendor role assignment and reference BP handling.

Some of the synchronization settings may now be managed via Central Business Configuration (CBC) or Fiori apps rather than classic SPRO nodes. Look for apps like Manage Business Partner Synchronization and Maintain Employee Vendor Mapping.

If the standard sync logic is too limited implement a BAdI such as BADI_CVI_CUSTOM_MAPPER or BADI_CVI_MAPPING to inject custom logic for:

  • Reference BP assignment
  • Blocking/unblocking logic
  • Bank ID mapping

This gives you full control over how HR infotype data is transformed into BP/vendor master data.

Finally, since the DDIC structures are missing and the SPRO path is unclear, raise an SAP support ticket referencing your upgrade path and missing functionality.

So the proposal summary is

entry.content:
ok, and point 3 of the sap note is also already done?

 If none of the above helped, make sure both users ops$<sid>adm and ops$ora<sid> have tablespace quota and RESOURCE privileges.

sqlplus / as sysdba
SQL> grant unlimited tablespace to <user>;
SQL> grant resource to <user>;
SQL> drop user sapsr3hd cascade;

 

furthermore there was a similar issue in following thread 

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/cannot-create-database-shadow-user-sapsr3shd/qaq-p/10278842

 

It did not work at once. We additionally executed the following.

Schema User = SAPERP in our environment.

create user SAPERPSHD identified by <PW>;
grant sapconn to SAPERPSHD;
brconnect -u / -c -f chpass -o SAPERPSHD -p <PW>;

CONNECT SAPERPSHD/<PW>;

1. brtools -c
2. 8 - Additional functions
3. 4 - Change password of database user
4. 3 ~ Database owner to change password (owner)
5. fill in ther new user, which pw you'd like to change e.g. SAPERPSHD
6. c
7. new PW
8. again new PW

This worked in our SUM upgrade.

entry.title: While resubmitting a document do not send is not available in the output settings
entry.content:
after scoping the do not send additional output option you created i.e. a customer invoice with send by:do not send.

 

In the initial output history it is shown as such, but if you resubmit do not send is not available.

This is correct as you already have an output as do not send.

In this case the option would not be available.

In case the initial output was i.e email or printer the do not send option is also not available.

Only for initial outputs do not send is applicable.

entry.title: Re: How to extract SAP BO - Is it necessary to unzip the...
entry.content:
The audit data is not encrypted.  As long as you can access the database you should have no problem reading the ads_* tables.

But using audit data for access details is not ideal, since it only records audited events.  To track which users and groups have access to content, you'll need to extract from the CMS.  That is encrypted and can't easily be retrieved directly from the CMS database.

entry.title: Re: Issue with Batch-Specific UOM Quantity Display in War...
entry.content:
Hello @SNarayan 

In SAP S/4HANA public cloud edition, there is no single setting to prevent back-dated billing documents (like VF01). Instead, there are several options supported, including.

Validation during Billing Document Creation

  • You can use the Cloud BAdI Billing Document ‚Äì Check Before Save SD_BIL_DOC_SAVE_CHECK to implement a date validation.
  • Consequently, the system generates an error if the billing date is earlier than the current system date, preventing the save.
  • Check this SAP Documentation: SAP Help ‚Äì BAdIs for Sales Billing

Control at the accounting level

    • To prevent postings into earlier periods, you can enforce this by keeping the posting periods closed in. Manage Posting Periods (App ID F2293).
    • Additionally, you can utilise the SAP Help-Manage Substitution/Validation Rules to halt postings where the accounting date is before today. This functions when billing has already been transferred to accounting.

Governance at UI Level

  • In the Create Billing Documents (Fiori app F0798), you can default the billing date to today and make the field non-editable for most users with UI Adaptation.

SAP Best Practice:

  • If you require a hard stop on any invoice dated before today, use the BAdI check.
  • If you only want to prevent prior-period postings, manage it through posting period control.
  • For governance with minimal effort, set today‚Äôs date as default and restrict editing through UI adjustments.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: White Space, Begone! New Pilot Removes Widgets Column from Blog Posts
entry.content:
For as long as I can remember, even going back to the previous SAP Community platform, members have asked us to reduce the amount of white space on post pages, arguing that the layout makes readability more difficult. It‚Äôs a complaint that continues today ‚Äì and one that we‚Äôre taking steps to address.

The current platform includes a column for widgets (e.g., Top Kudoed Authors), but, depending on the length of a blog post, that column might be mostly blank. For that reason, members have requested its removal, and we‚Äôre now testing the favorability of that approach.

To help illustrate the point, here‚Äôs a blog post with the widgets column:

Now here‚Äôs the very same post with the widgets column (and white space) removed:

What do you think? Better? Worse? Don‚Äôt care one way or the other? We‚Äôre running a four-week pilot (starting today) so you can let us know!

To experience a blog board free of the widgets column (and the white space that comes with), head on over to the Application Development and Automation group. We‚Äôre currently testing that look and feel over there to give members the opportunity to view blog posts without the widgets.

(Note: We are aware of issues with the formatting of some posts now that we've removed the widgets column. If this change affected the placement of images in your post, for example, you'll need to edit to correct. Per the "Blog Formatting Post-Migration" section of this post, it's best to use the blog tool as intended, making sure to avoid complicated html and to clear formatting when copying over text.)  

Compare the blog posts in the Application Development and Automation group to blog posts in other areas on the community. If you prefer the new widget-less layout, let us know in the comments below. Or, if you favor blog posts with widgets and the white space, make sure to share your opinions in the comments as well. We‚Äôll review all feedback received between today (Tuesday, August 26) and Tuesday, September 23, then determine which layout members seem to favor.

If enough members choose the new approach (with the widgets and space gone), we can update all blog boards to match what you see in the Application Development and Automation group. Then again, if members tell us to leave the current layout alone, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôll do (and we‚Äôll switch the Application Development and Automation posts back to match the other boards).

Will we change the status of this feedback item to ‚ÄúDelivered‚Äù? Or ‚ÄúDeclined‚Äù? You can help us decide!

With this pilot, we‚Äôre inviting members to provide feedback that will help influence the design of our site ‚Äì as it should be in a community that belongs to all of us.

We look forward to reading your input below!

entry.title: Re: SAP Analytics Cloud for planning - Strange behaviour...
entry.content:
Hello @guenay 

for me, it looks like there must still be some old values in the SAC model, on your master data combinations, which you want to plan.

To make sure, I would recommend trying to delete the model data for these combinations and then then retry again.

Usually, there is a "Rest distribution" if the values cannot be divided by 12 months... but this is then applied only to one month:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/fac0e8d372634024b7f2fb275ee98bc7.html?locale=en-US#rest-distribution 

Your situation looks more like data on one of the accounts, used in the formula.

BR, Martin

entry.title: SAP Datasphere - How to configure the AWS Assume Role option for an AWS S3 connection
entry.content:
I have been seeing questions on the S3 connection option to Assume Role in SAP Datasphere.  This article shows how I set up my S3 connection in SAP Datasphere to use this functionality. 

There are multiple methods to connect to AWS S3, this is one approach that may work for your environment.   SAP Datasphere can be deployed on multiple hyperscalers so this approach works for all deployments of SAP Datasphere.   The details for the S3 connection in SAP Datasphere are available in our help documentation. 

Disclaimer - I am not a deep AWS expert, please verify any security deployments with your AWS team.

 

I started with this AWS Reference link: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/code-library/latest/ug/iam_example_iam_Scenario_CreateUserAssumeRole_section.html

Summary: 

  • Create a S3 user with no permissions and secret key/access key
  • Create a role that grants permission to list Amazon S3 buckets for the account.
  • Add a policy to let the user assume the role
  • Assume the role and list S3 buckets using temporary credentials, then clean up resources.

FIrst we create a user with no permissions in AWS

Then create Access Keys for the user:

Note the keys down for use in the SAP Datasphere connection.  

Next, create a role that allows the sts:AssumeRole permission.  Capture the ARN for this role to be used in the SAP Datasphere connection. 

Here's the role I created, with my account ID removed:

Role
{
    "Version": "2012-10-17",
    "Statement": [
        {
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Principal": {
                "AWS": "arn:aws:iam::<REPLACE with your AWS Acct ID>:user/assume_user_demo_no_permissions"
            },
            "Action": "sts:AssumeRole"
        }
    ]
}

 

Now create a Policy that exposes the AWS S3 bucket(s):

Here's the Policy definition I used - please adjust it if necessary based on your specific requirements:

 

Policy: 
{
    "Version": "2012-10-17",
    "Statement": [
        {
            "Sid": "VisualEditor0",
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Action": [
                "s3:ListTagsForResource",
                "s3:PutObject",
                "s3:GetObject",
                "s3:ListBucketMultipartUploads",
                "s3:PutObjectRetention",
                "s3:DeleteObjectVersion",
                "s3:GetObjectTagging",
                "s3:ListBucket",
                "s3:DeleteObject",
                "s3:GetBucketAcl",
                "s3:GetBucketPolicy"
            ],
            "Resource": [
                "arn:aws:s3:*:REPLACE with your AWS Acct ID>:access-grants/default/grant/*",
                "arn:aws:s3:::assume-role-bucket-dsp",
                "arn:aws:s3:::*/*",
                "arn:aws:s3:*:REPLACE with your AWS Acct ID>:storage-lens-group/*",
                "arn:aws:s3:*:REPLACE with your AWS Acct ID>:access-grants/default/location/*",
                "arn:aws:s3:*:REPLACE with your AWS Acct ID>:access-grants/default"
            ]
        },
        {
            "Sid": "VisualEditor1",
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Action": "s3:ListAllMyBuckets",
            "Resource": "*"
        }
    ]
}

Create the S3 Bucket Policy

 

Bucket Policy:

Bucket policy: 
{
    "Version": "2012-10-17",
    "Statement": [
        {
            "Effect": "Deny",
            "Principal": "*",
            "Action": "s3:*",
            "Resource": [
                "arn:aws:s3:::assume-role-bucket-dsp",
                "arn:aws:s3:::assume-role-bucket-dsp/*"
            ],
            "Condition": {
                "Bool": {
                    "aws:SecureTransport": "false"
                },
                "NumericLessThan": {
                    "s3:TlsVersion": "1.2"
                }
            }
        }
    ]
}

 

Now that you have the secret key/access key and ARN for the assume role, you can create the connection in SAP Datasphere..  Navigate to your Connections area within your Space and select Amazon Simple Storage Service:

Note the endpoint contains the region in format:   s3.<region>.amazonaws.com.   Enable Assume Role by changing the value of Use Assume Role to true and Include the Role ARN in the Assume Role section of the Connection. 

Save and Validate the connection in SAP Datasphere

If you used my Role and Policy, then using S3 as a target in Replication Flows will work!

entry.title: Re: Couldn't subscribe to Integration Suite. Try again. I...
entry.content:
If you are getting this message when subscribing to Integration Suite after deletion of a previous subscription, it is most probably due to runtime resources not cleaned up yet from the previous subscription. Usually, 30 to 60 minutes are enough for the clean up. 

If you are getting this message when subscribing for the first time, I can't think of any reasonable cause.

Feel free to post your ideas and requests at https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/2282.

Regards
Dimiter

entry.title: Re: Automate PFCG process
entry.content:
No, it has nothing to do with the method call.  I have that working successfully.  It correctly shows up in the Role Menu in PFCG, but it also shows up in the user's SAP GUI menu.   This is snippet of code used to accomplish that:

* Add the T-Code to the User Role

l_tcode = 'SE16'.
    CALL METHOD l_class->menu_add_transaction
      EXPORTING
*       iv_target_id            =
        iv_tcode  = l_tcode
*       iv_first_node_in_folder = 'X'
*       iv_node_text            =
      IMPORTING
*       ev_new_object_id        =
        et_return = l_rettab.

* Save and Unlock the User Role
    CALL METHOD l_class->save
      IMPORTING
        et_return = l_rettab.

* Regenerate the Role
  CALL FUNCTION 'PRGN_AUTO_GENERATE_PROFILE_NEW'
    EXPORTING
      activity_group       = p_role
*     PROFILE_NAME         =
*     PROFILE_TEXT         =
*     NO_DIALOG            = 'X'
*     REBUILD_AUTH_DATA    = 'X'
      org_levels_with_star = 'X'
*     ORG_LEVELS_WITH_STAR =
*     FILL_EMPTY_FIELDS_WITH_STAR         = 'X'
*     TEMPLATE             =
*     CHECK_PROFGEN_TABLES =
*     GENERATE_PROFILE     = 'X'
*     AUTHORITY_CHECK_PFCG =
*     REQUEST              =
* IMPORTING
*     NEW_REQUEST          =
    TABLES
      return               = l_rettab
*     MANUAL_AUTHS         =
*     OBJCTS_EXCL          =
* EXCEPTIONS
*     ACTIVITY_GROUP_DOES_NOT_EXIST       = 1
*     ACTIVITY_GROUP_ENQUEUED             = 2
*     PROFILE_NAME_EXISTS  = 3
*     PROFILE_NOT_IN_NAMESPACE            = 4
*     NO_AUTH_FOR_PROF_CREATION           = 5
*     NO_AUTH_FOR_ROLE_CHANGE             = 6
*     NO_AUTH_FOR_AUTH_MAINT              = 7
*     NO_AUTH_FOR_GEN      = 8
*     NO_AUTHS             = 9
*     OPEN_AUTHS           = 10
*     TOO_MANY_AUTHS       = 11
*     PROFGEN_TABLES_NOT_UPDATED          = 12
*     ERROR_WHEN_GENERATING_PROFILE       = 13
*     OTHERS               = 14.

I removed the error checking, etc. so only relevant code is displayed.  This works:

However, although I don't have the credentials to log on with that user, the role will also show up here in the SAP Menu, which is what we want to avoid.

entry.title: Re: Changing Service Entry Sheet - Call Transaction / BAPI / etc
entry.content:
Official answer by SAP in the SAP note 1977305 - Is there a BAPI to modify Service Entry Sheets? - SAP for Me:

"There is no BAPI to change or modify (apart from delete, release, etc.) a service entry sheet. Please consider using the workaround below:

  • Delete the old SES by BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_DELETE.
  • Create a new SES based on the new information by BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_CREATE."

entry.title: Re: Issue with Batch-Specific UOM Quantity Display in War...
entry.content:
Hello @SNarayan 

Thank you for your question and for sharing the screenshots. This is standard behaviour in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

  • Inventory Stock apps, like Stock ‚Äì Single Material, display stock in the base UoM (TO) along with batch conversion details, making it easier to understand and manage your stock.
  • Warehouse Monitor displays stock in the alternative or batch-specific units of measure (EA) based on batch characteristics.

Not an error, just a different display logic, Inventory vs. EWM. Use stock reports if both views are necessary.

With kind regards

Chuma

SAP Help-Batch-Specific Units of Measure

SAP Help - Warehouse Management Monitor

entry.title: Re: SAP Authorization issue
entry.content:
So, basically you want to limit the activity for the user and I assume you are working with Fiori. 

Create a custom BR, assign the following catalogs according to your needs: 

SAP_MM_BC_INV_DOC_DSP_PC - for display

SAP_MM_BC_INV_PARK_PC - hold/park/park as complete

SAP_MM_BC_INV_RELEASE_PC - release 

Also you need to check the backend authorizations, according to the note 2931137 - User authorizations in Supplier Invoice Apps (On Premise) - SAP S/4HANA

Find the roles on user with the respective auth. objects, only assign roles without activity 01 (create)

note: When you are raising questions, It's better to elaborate the product and function you are working on. private cloud? on premise? public cloud... fiori or gui?

entry.title: Unpacking the new SAP Business Suite
entry.content:
This blog intends to provide a quick explanation of the newly announced SAP Business Suite. The blog contains the latest information as of August 2025.

In February 2025, SAP announced the new SAP Business Suite (https://www.sap.com/events/business-unleashed.html), which was also covered in detail at our prime SAP SAPPHIRE events in Orlando, Madrid, and all the SAP Now events around the world. But you might be wondering what the new SAP Business Suite is.

Simply put, the SAP Business Suite helps our customers drive business innovation to achieve more valuable business outcomes in a constantly changing economy‚Äîby uniting core SAP business applications, data, and Business AI capabilities.

New SAP Business Suite

The SAP Business Suite is not simply a harmonization of release and maintenance schedules for SAP‚Äôs portfolio of solutions. It serves as a transformation engine, helping customers generate rapid cycles of innovation and continuous improvement as a service. This enables organizations to deliver greater business value and achieve improved outcomes through end-to-end processes.

SAP‚Äôs Business Suite applications (like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP SuccessFactors, SAP Concur, etc.) and SAP Business Technology Platform aren‚Äôt just siloed applications; they are integrated along end to end business process, supporting you in every business decision and outcome. This integration ensures that every action taken within these applications generates trusted, business-critical data at its source.

Within the SAP Business Suite, we have also integrated the SAP Business Data Cloud. The SAP Business Data Cloud was also announced in February 2025 . The SAP Business Data Cloud centralizes, harmonizes, and enriches the data produced by the SAP applications and non-SAP applications. So the SAP Business Data Cloud helps us unify data into a single source of truth. Now if this data is contextualized, reliable, and accessible, this data becomes the fuel for advanced AI-driven insights. SAP Business AI, included in the SAP Business Suite, goes beyond basic automation. Through SAP Joule, our AI copilot and the embedded AI capabilities in our applications, employees can orchestrate intelligent agents to collaborate across functions or get enhanced scenarios to increase productivity. This strategy breaks down silos, driving real-time, cross-enterprise optimization. We know our customers are deploying AI in isolated projects, but with our SAP Business Suite strategy, we weave it throughout your organization, unlocking value and resilience at scale.

Let‚Äôs get practical and explain how our customers consume the SAP Business Suite as a service. Next, I will cover the new SAP Business Suite Packages and the journey our customers can follow to implement them.

SAP has created buying center-based packages which provide our customers with defined functional capabilities within our core applications portfolio, data, and Business AI.  The idea is that the package can provide all the necessary capabilities for this buying center and its teams to carry out their responsibilities.

New buying center-based SAP Business Suite Packages

Now, SAP is providing two journeys for our customers so they can consume the SAP Business Suite as a service. The journeys are RISE with SAP and GROW with SAP. Before the February 2025 announcement, RISE with SAP was focused on our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and GROW with SAP was focused on our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Customer Journeys to New SAP Business Suite

Following the introduction of the SAP Business Suite, we have evolved our programs and made several enhancements to the commercial packages supporting these journeys to better serve our customers.

RISE with SAP is a journey focused on existing SAP ERP on-premise customers who are looking to modernize their legacy systems with SAP Business Suite, while GROW with SAP is a journey focused on new SAP ERP customers looking to start fresh with SAP Business Suite.

We also made changes to some names to group our solutions. We now refer to everything relevant to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and its extended capabilities offered in the SAP Business Suite Packages as "SAP Cloud ERP," and everything relevant to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and the extended capabilities offered in the SAP Business Suite Packages as "SAP Cloud ERP Private."

Now, how do we align the SAP Business Suite packages with the customer journeys?  In the figure, you can see that customers have options depending on their SAP journey and buying center. These packages can also be consumed by buying center or brought together for the entire company and buying centers. If you would like to learn more about our packages and what is included, I suggest you visit this link: https://www.sap.com/products/business-suite/pricing.html

Buying center-based packages that enable customer journeys to the new SAP Business Suite

In this blog, I want to focus more on the journeys and packages that have traditionally covered ERP functionalities by highlighting the CIO buying center and the needs of a company-wide system, including other C-suite buying centers who rely on ERP as a comprehensive solution to streamline the introduction of this concept. I won‚Äôt cover other subscriptions like add-ons, data product packages, and AI packages included in the SAP Business Suite, etc., to keep it simple and easy to understand.

Let's begin with Cloud ERP Private. This package is designed to provide customers with tailored-to-fit functionality, a very flexible system in which they maintain the governance of the system while SAP supports operations.

Here, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is included; however, this package encompasses many more capabilities and components compared to traditional ERP (SAP ERP 6.0). The following components are included:

Components included in Cloud ERP Private Package

The SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management packages include many different SAP components supporting the CFO and COO buying centers in running their business responsibilities. Here is where you find SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, a system designed to drive business standardization using a fit-to-standard approach, with rapid and agile innovation cycles, operated and governed by SAP.

Each of these packages includes two types of sub-packages: Base and Premium. The idea is to provide customers with flexibility when deciding on the main capabilities for each buying center. Below, I present the capabilities of the two packages:

Components included in SAP Finance Package

Components included in SAP Supply Chain Package

As you can see from the packages, the entitlements provided encompass more comprehensive capabilities and components compared to the standalone SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, offering greater business benefits and functional features.

To view the current packages and included capabilities, please refer to: https://www.sap.com/products/business-suite/pricing.html

Sample Customer Journeys:

SAP ERP 6.0 customer looking to move to the new SAP Business Suite.

This customer will use the RISE with SAP customer journey to move to the new SAP Business Suite. Here, the customer will have the option to select between various packages depending on their business needs. Considering that this customer runs full capabilities (FI-CO, SD, MM, PP, QM, etc.) in SAP ERP 6.0, below are the choices:

Customer Journey ‚Äì RISE with SAP ‚Äì Final Destination SAP Business Suite

SAP will support the customer with the selection of the right packages by using the SAP Digital Discovery Assessment (SAP DDA). The SAP DDA helps the customer assess functional needs and provides recommendations accordingly. However, it is important to note that the packages are meant to serve two distinct business purposes: Cloud ERP Private‚Äîtailored-to-fit functionality with a highly flexible system where the customer maintains governance while SAP supports operations‚Äîand SAP Finance & SAP Supply Chain, which is designed to drive business standardization using a fit-to-standard approach, featuring rapid and agile innovation cycles, and operated and governed by SAP.  While the SAP DDA assesses functional requirements, the customer must decide on their main strategy: whether to implement and operate their systems with a tailored-to-fit solution or embrace a fit-to-standard model.

SAP Digital Discovery Assessment

Now let's talk a bit more in detail about the journey based on the package selection.

Cloud ERP Private ‚Äì An SAP ERP 6.0 customer needs tailored-to-fit functionality, with a very flexible system in which they maintain governance of the system while SAP supports operations. This customer has selected the Cloud ERP Private Package. Here, they first need to plan their journey to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition from SAP ERP 6.0 using one of the known transition paths: New Implementation, Selective Data Transition, or System Conversion. They will benefit from the use of transformation tools and services included in the package and can also take advantage of the other components included in the package.

Customer Journey ‚Äì RISE with SAP ‚Äì Final Destination SAP Business Suite via Cloud ERP Private Package

SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management packages ‚Äì An SAP ERP 6.0 customer decided on a state-of-the-art system designed to drive business standardization using a fit-to-standard approach, with rapid and agile innovation cycles and operated and governed by SAP. This customer has selected the SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management packages. Here, they first need to plan their journey to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition from SAP ERP 6.0 using a New Implementation. They will benefit from using SAP Activate, the SAP Signavio Process Navigator, and SAP Cloud ALM to drive their implementation, and can also take advantage of the other components included in the package (either base or premium).

Customer Journey ‚Äì RISE with SAP ‚Äì Final Destination SAP Business Suite via SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Packages

To make the most of all the components included in these packages, the SAP Activate Methodology has been enhanced, and there is now a new roadmap available for provisioning SAP Business Suite Packages. I highly recommend using it to take full advantage of the additional components offered.

New SAP Activate for provisioning new SAP Business Suite Packages

New SAP customer looking to move to the new SAP Business Suite.

This customer will use the GROW with SAP customer journey to move to the new SAP Business Suite. Here, the customer will be defaulted to the SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain packages, as our SAP Cloud ERP is the most transformational one.

However, if the new customer might be looking for more tailored-to-fit functionality‚Äîa very flexible system in which they maintain the governance of the system while SAP supports operations‚Äîthe Cloud ERP Package can be offered after the review with the SAP Digital Discovery Assessment.

Customer Journey ‚Äì GROW with SAP ‚Äì Final Destination SAP Business Suite via SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Packages

As indicated before to make the most of all the components included in these SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management packages, the SAP Activate Methodology has been enhanced, and there is now a new roadmap available for provisioning SAP Business Suite Packages.

 

So, what about the other SAP Business Suite packages‚ÄîSAP Strategic Procurement, SAP Core HR, and SAP CX?

These packages were designed based on personas. They provide our customers with defined functional capabilities within our core applications portfolio, data, and Business AI for a specific line of business. However, in combination with the Cloud ERP Private Package or the SAP Finance & SAP Supply Chain Management Package, they can offer even greater business benefits.

So, as in the example above, if an SAP ERP 6.0 customer is also running a legacy SAP ERP HCM system, they can adopt the new package for SAP Core HR to run SAP SuccessFactors and help them manage strategic human resources with solutions like SuccessFactors Employee Central, SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll, SuccessFactors Time Tracking, etc. SAP SuccessFactors is the next-generation cloud HR product, and this is where we are recommending our customers to move.

If the SAP ERP 6.0 customer is running a legacy SAP SRM 7.0 or any other legacy system to manage strategic sourcing, contract management, or is looking to implement these capabilities, they can choose SAP Strategic Procurement‚Äîan integrated solution bundle for managing the source-to-contract process through sourcing, contract management, supplier lifecycle, and performance management. Included solutions are: SAP Ariba Sourcing, SAP Ariba Contracts, SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance.

If the SAP ERP 6.0 customer is running a legacy SAP CRM 7.0 or any other legacy system to manage comprehensive sales management, service management, or marketing capabilities, then the SAP CX Package (to be delivered in Q3 2025) can help the customer leverage the latest CX portfolio, such as SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud.

All Business Suite Packages that are available to existing on-premises SAP ERP 6.0 customers through the RISE with SAP customer journey

The same availability of SAP Business Suite Packages can be provided to a new SAP customer to complement the SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management Packages.

All Business Suite Packages that are available to new SAP customers through the GROW with SAP customer journey

As indicated before, the new SAP Business Suite is not just a harmonization of a release and maintenance schedule of SAP‚Äôs portfolio of solutions. It‚Äôs a transformation engine that helps customers create rapid cycles of innovation end-to-end and continuous improvement as a service. In this regard, SAP is planning to make running the SAP Business Suite easier for customers and is planning to manage the integration of components. Early next year, SAP plans to begin offering SAP Cloud ERP + SAP Core HR managed integration as a service and will continue to introduce more in the future. Of course, these plans are subject to change.

We believe the new SAP Business Suite will help our customers gain more business outcomes by unlocking value and resilience at scale by combining core applications, data and business AI.

I would like to thank my colleagues, Daniel Kesenheimer, Elena Tewari, Matt Emmert & Marcus Venth, for their review and feedback on this blog.

Your insights and opinions are valuable, so please don't hesitate to contribute by commenting on this blog.

entry.title: Could not fetch JWT bearer token for service of type destination. Unable to map issuer: Origin claim
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I have two CAP applications, where I'm doing the backend services. The apps are in the same subaccount, and it have individual xsuaa services.

The application "A" exposed a service url to be consumed by UI5 application with a destination type OAuth2UserTokenExchange and it's working fine.

The application "B" exposed other service using other destination with the same type OAuth2UserTokenExchange. In this service, I need consume the service from "A". To do this, I imported it as external service and I configured the destination in the package.json file.

When I consume it, using cds objects ( const remoteService = await cds.connect.to('API...'), I get this error:

ERR message: 'Error during request to remote service: Failed to load destination. Caused by: Could not fetch JWT bearer token for service of type destination: HTTP response from https://xxx/oauth/token was 401: {"error":"unauthorized","error_description":"Unable to map issuer: Origin claim is missing in the token."}.'

If I use a destination type OAuth2ClientCredentials works correctly.

Is it possible to propagate the user token using the CDS object, or do I need to make a REST call that includes the token?"

Thanks and regards.

entry.title: Re: BAPI to unaccept service entry sheet
entry.content:
No that's wrong. The question is about revoking the acceptance, not about undo release.

In transaction ML81N, that's the undo button:

The only way is to use Batch Input. It works on ML81N:

" Batch input to revoke acceptance of service entry sheet
" based on ZCL_TOOL_BI_TRANSACTION:
"   Blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-members/community-project-batch-input-toolbox-for-abap/ba-p/14068601
"   Code: https://github.com/jrgkraus/tool-bi
FORM revoke_acceptance_of_ses USING iv_entrysheet TYPE bapiessr-sheet_no.
  DATA(lo_ml81n) = NEW zcl_tool_bi_transaction( 'ML81N' ).

  " 1st screen of ML81N: click on the Other command button
  lo_ml81n->new_dynpro(
    )->program( 'SAPLMLSR'
    )->dynpro( '0400'
    )->ok_code( '=SELP' ).

  " Popup asking which service sheet to display
  lo_ml81n->new_dynpro(
    )->program( 'SAPLMLSR'
    )->dynpro( '0340'
    )->field( 'RM11R-LBLNI' )->value( iv_entrysheet
    )->ok_code( '=ENTE' ).

  " Screen showing the service sheet in display mode, click on the Edit button
  lo_ml81n->new_dynpro(
    )->program( 'SAPLMLSR'
    )->dynpro( '0400'
    )->ok_code( '=AKCH' ).

  " Screen showing the service sheet in modification mode, click on the Revoke Acceptance button
  " NB: potential errors:
  "   - If the sheet is not accepted (ESSR-KZABN = ''), the Revoke Acceptance button is not shown: The function code cannot be selected (Message No. 00255)
  lo_ml81n->new_dynpro(
    )->program( 'SAPLMLSR'
    )->dynpro( '0400'
    )->ok_code( '=ACCR' ).

  " Screen showing the service sheet in modification mode, click on the Save button
  lo_ml81n->new_dynpro(
    )->program( 'SAPLMLSR'
    )->dynpro( '0400'
    )->ok_code( '=SAVE' ).

  " Popup asking for document date and accounting date
  DATA lv_aujourdhui_format_externe TYPE c LENGTH 10.
  lv_aujourdhui_format_externe = |{ sy-datum DATE = USER }|.
  lo_ml81n->new_dynpro(
    )->program( 'SAPLMLSR'
    )->dynpro( '0110'
    )->field( 'IMKPF-BLDAT' )->value( lv_aujourdhui_format_externe
    )->field( 'IMKPF-BUDAT' )->value( lv_aujourdhui_format_externe
    )->ok_code( 'ENTE' ).

  DATA lv_mode                    TYPE ctu_params-dismode VALUE 'N'.
  DATA lo_logger                  TYPE REF TO zif_logger.
  DATA lv_result_call_transaction TYPE sysubrc.

  lo_logger = zcl_logger_factory=>create_log( ).
  lo_ml81n->mode( lv_mode )->update( 'L' ).

  lv_result_call_transaction = lo_ml81n->run( lo_logger ).

  IF lv_resultat_call_transaction <> 0.
    " < 1000 : error message (A or E) during batch input execution,
    " = 1001 : technical error (messages S00341 to S00349)
    lo_logger->popup( ).
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: Re: How to send Data (Integration) from SAP Datasphere to...
entry.content:
Hi @897654208074 

For your scenario integrating SAP Datasphere with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud the integration is supported but requires correct communication management setup on the S/4HANA Cloud side. Let me break it down for you:

Below are the integration Approach

  • Group Reporting Data Collection consumes data via OData services from external sources, in this case SAP Datasphere.
  • Datasphere acts as the source system, while S/4HANA Cloud GRDC is the target.
  • Communication between the two is secured by creating a Communication System, Communication User and Communication Arrangement in S/4HANA Cloud.

 

Here are steps you need to configure

  1. In S/4HANA Public Cloud
  1. First, create a Communication User
    • App: Maintain Communication Users
    • Define user ID and password which will be used by Datasphere.
  2. Secondly, create a Communication System
    • App: Maintain Communication Systems
    • Enter the following:
      • Host = Datasphere tenant URL for example https://<tenant>.eu10.hcs.cloud.sap
      • Outbound authentication = User ID and password of the communication user.
      • Inbound: assign the same communication user.
  3. Create a Communication Arrangement
    • App: Maintain Communication Arrangements
    • Scenario: SAP_COM_0108 Group Reporting Data Collection
    • Assign the Communication System and User.
    • This generates the service URL and credentials that Datasphere will use to push data.

 

  1. In SAP Datasphere
  • Use the Data Flow or Data Integration feature to push data into the GRDC OData service:
    • Endpoint is URL from the Communication Arrangement in S/4HANA Cloud.
    • Authentication is Communication User and password created above.
  • Datasphere allows you to map your data consolidation unit, FS item, partner unit, etc. to the GRDC input structure.

 

Yes, all communication is done over HTTPS, so data in transit is encrypted. The Communication Arrangement enforces secure authentication.

SAP Group Reporting Data Collection

SAP Group Reporting Data Collection with SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Integration with SAP Datasphere

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Change Pointers for Planned Orders (LOIPLO) not working - what am I missing?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm trying to set up change pointers on planned orders (LOIPLO) to track changes, but I'm running into an issue and hope someone can point me in the right direction.

I've already completed the following configuration steps:

  • SCDO - Created change document object for LOIPLO

  • BD50 - Activated change pointers for LOIPLO

  • BD52 - Defined fields for which change documents should be written

The general change pointers are activated in BD61 and work perfectly fine with other message types, so the basic configuration seems to be correct.

However, when I modify the Total Quantity field in a planned order, no new entry is created in table BDCP2. This is quite puzzling since everything else appears to be working as expected.

Have I overlooked an important configuration step? I'm grateful for any hints or suggestions from anyone who has worked with LOIPLO change pointers before.

Thanks in advance for your help!
